Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, Athlonic said:

Got a KSP v1.4 ready devbuild working 

I will upload it when back from work in a few hours.

Thanks!!!

Nevermind ...

Why modding at home when you can do it from work (don't tell my boss)

Update out :

Quote

v0.9.94 [12 Mar 2018]
- Recompiled for KSP v1.4.0.2077
- Fixed reverb_filter deprecated function roomRolloff preventing plugin execution in KSP v1.4
Woohoo! One of my favorite mods! You don’t realize how important it is until you’re playing without it. EVA’s without the ker-PLUNK PSSSSSHHHHHH are just not the same!

4 hours ago, Athlonic said:

Got a KSP v1.4 ready devbuild working 

I will upload it when back from work in a few hours.

Sweeet  Thanks so much man!

There's not a lot of chatter. A little bit after an EVA (or ending one) but that's about it (using default settings). After an EVA the debug window shows "initiating chatter" (or something along those lines) and then nothing.
Side note:  anyone feel like GameData\Chatterer\Sounds\chatter\valentina\capsuleF\capsule_25.ogg sounds like she's saying "We need to resist them and make them give us the best EVAs"?
If I'm going to stay with 1.3.1 for awhile, should I not install this latest update (for 1.4)?

52 minutes ago, MikeO89 said:

If I'm going to stay with 1.3.1 for awhile, should I not install this latest update (for 1.4)?

The previous version worked better for me in 1.3.1 than the new version does in 1.4; that’s all I can say.

11 hours ago, Kerbart said:

There's not a lot of chatter. A little bit after an EVA (or ending one) but that's about it (using default settings). After an EVA the debug window shows "initiating chatter" (or something along those lines) and then nothing.

Yep, thanks for pointing this out.

I can reproduce the issue : chatter exchanges stop working for some reason (until EVA or vessel swap), no clue for now. I will have a look at this.

2 hours ago, Athlonic said:

Yep, thanks for pointing this out.

I can reproduce the issue : chatter exchanges stop working for some reason (until EVA or vessel swap), no clue for now. I will have a look at this.

I read somewhere about a thunderous speech Gene Kerman held in the Austronaut Center about “professional work attitude” and “com lines are for mission updates, not idle banter,” perhaps that’s what’s caused it?

Take your time, your mod is greatly appreciated, but it should be a hobby and not an obligation!

Hi I just love Chatterer, it's one of my favorite mods. :-) Though I'm trying to use it with CKAN, and the version file might need some adjusting. I could be wrong but I don't think version .94 works with KSP 1.3.1 or earlier. Though the version file says it does: 

{
	"NAME":"Chatterer",
	"URL":"http://ksp-avc.cybutek.net/version.php?id=27",
	"VERSION":
	{
		"MAJOR":0,
		"MINOR":9,
		"PATCH":94,
		"BUILD":2077
	},
	"KSP_VERSION":
	{
		"MAJOR":1,
		"MINOR":4,
		"PATCH":0
	},
	"KSP_VERSION_MIN":
    {
        "MAJOR":1,
        "MINOR":3,
        "PATCH":0
    },
	"KSP_VERSION_MAX":
    {
        "MAJOR":1,
        "MINOR":4,
        "PATCH":99
    },

This means that CKAN will pick the wrong version for 1.3.1.

Thanks checking it out. Oh if there is a bug tracker that you would rather I use, please let me know.  :-)

    Karn
theres a male kerbal thats sounds like he says " yer stupid again.....yer stupid again scott manley"

Hey guys i tried to install chatterer, to my new ksp copy (1.4.1), via ckan ,but windows defender block the Chatterer.dll. Any of you have any idea why this happens? Why windows defender recognize this dll as a threat?

Huh ? That's new.

Just did a scan with Defender on my original .dll and nothing.

Hold on will try to grab via CKAN as well...

Edit : No threat here, I am afraid the dll should have been infected on your machine after the download, do I full scan to be safe.

PS : also avoid to install your KSP in the Program Files folder as Windows protection might prevent some mods from working correctly.

Edited March 17, 2018 by Athlonic

On 16/03/2018 at 3:20 AM, Karn said:

Hi I just love Chatterer, it's one of my favorite mods. :-) Though I'm trying to use it with CKAN, and the version file might need some adjusting. I could be wrong but I don't think version .94 works with KSP 1.3.1 or earlier. Though the version file says it does: 


{
	"NAME":"Chatterer",
	"URL":"http://ksp-avc.cybutek.net/version.php?id=27",
	"VERSION":
	{
		"MAJOR":0,
		"MINOR":9,
		"PATCH":94,
		"BUILD":2077
	},
	"KSP_VERSION":
	{
		"MAJOR":1,
		"MINOR":4,
		"PATCH":0
	},
	"KSP_VERSION_MIN":
    {
        "MAJOR":1,
        "MINOR":3,
        "PATCH":0
    },
	"KSP_VERSION_MAX":
    {
        "MAJOR":1,
        "MINOR":4,
        "PATCH":99
    },

This means that CKAN will pick the wrong version for 1.3.1.

Thanks checking it out. Oh if there is a bug tracker that you would rather I use, please let me know.  :-)

    Karn

Nice catch Karn ! thanks a lot

I changed the AVC online version file accordingly.

CKAN seems to pick the old version for 1.3.1 now (not sure if someone fixed the metadata or if my change did it though ^^ ) as v0.94 isn't working with KSP 1.4, 1.4.1 at all (I should have checked this, #mybad)

8 hours ago, obrelix said:

Hey guys i tried to install chatterer, to my new ksp copy (1.4.1), via ckan ,but windows defender block the Chatterer.dll. Any of you have any idea why this happens? Why windows defender recognize this dll as a threat?

I'm reproducing the same, Windows Defender identifying both the preexisting DLL and new download from Spacedock as Trojan:Win32/Critet.BS.
Interesting ...

1 hour ago, Athlonic said:

 

Interesting ...

I reported this same false-positive in the MechJeb thread, as it's affecting that .dll as well. When I discovered this morning that MJ wasn't working, I started digging through my KSP Game Data folder and sure enough, chatterer.dll had been removed too. I manually updated my Windows Defender definitions this afternoon and while Microsoft's definitions file has been updated just since this morning, both MechJeb2.dll and Chatterer.dll are still being flagged as infected files.
Defender is trolling us !

Well, same here:

Trojan:Win32/Critet.BS

file: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Chatterer\Plugins\Chatterer.dll

Soooo....do I trust that these files are safe, or did this get compiled with an infected dependency?  I'm going to err on the side of caution for this one.  Pity, as everything feels eerily quiet now.
It appears other apps are having issues as well, and it seems to be connected to the Unity engine somehow.  Here's the Reddit thread:

I manually load all my mods, and run chatter just fine. I also Use ESET on the strict levels where it scans everything.

Edited March 17, 2018 by viperwolf

2 hours ago, macr0t0r said:

Well, same here:

Trojan:Win32/Critet.BS

file: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Chatterer\Plugins\Chatterer.dll

Soooo....do I trust that these files are safe, or did this get compiled with an infected dependency?  I'm going to err on the side of caution for this one.  Pity, as everything feels eerily quiet now.

It's a false-positive hit from Defender. I even manually uploaded the file to Microsoft's Windows Defender security page and it was scanned as safe, but the latest downloadable malware definitions file as of this evening STILL marked it as it as infected, along with the MechJeb2.dll file and ModuleManager.3.0.6.dll.

On 3/12/2018 at 8:46 PM, Kerbart said:

There's not a lot of chatter. A little bit after an EVA (or ending one) but that's about it (using default settings). After an EVA the debug window shows "initiating chatter" (or something along those lines) and then nothing.

Interestingly this seemed a 1.4.0 bug; in 1.4.1 Chatter seems to work just fine.
I just downloaded the latest version off Spacedock and got the "Trojan:Win32/Critet.BS" warning as well. Is there any chance one of your dependencies has been infected?
